name: mudlark
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly UK someone who searches the mud (= soft, wet ground) near rivers trying to find valuable or interesting objects: There is a collection of medieval artefacts unearthed by mudlarks and and metal detectors.
UK a horse who runs well on soft, wet ground: The very soft ground should suit Trans Island who is a real mudlark.
More examplesFewer examplesPoor Victorian children, nicknamed mudlarks, used to dig at low tide in the foul-smelling muck of the Thames to scavenge lumps of coal and other items they could sell for a few pence. Beachcombing has provided a way of life for generations of mudlarks living close to the tidal foreshores of the Thames and the Medway.The firm going at Aintree is bad news for mudlarks.Edmond's trainer was hoping for softer ground for the confirmed mudlark.
